title: `clone()` configures adjusted branch as 'upstream'

labels.name: adjusted-branches
labels.description: Issues caused by or affected adjusted branch operation

body:
Cloning a dataset that has an adjusted master, yields this configuration in the clone:

```
branch.adjusted/master(unlocked).remote=origin
branch.adjusted/master(unlocked).merge=refs/heads/adjusted/master(unlocked)
```

This will make any `git push` push something that is being rebased all the time back to `origin`. This is likely to fail, and be rather confusing, as git will recommend conflict resolution approaches that are all wrong (actually needs `annex sync`). With this config removed, things will go back to 

```
% git push --dry-run --porcelain      
fatal: The current branch adjusted/master(unlocked) has no upstream branch.
To push the current branch and set the remote as upstream, use

    git push --set-upstream origin adjusted/master(unlocked)
```

which seems better. Confusingly, however, the adjusted branch will still be pushed to any other remote:

```
% git push --dry-run --porcelain target
To /media/mih/Samsung_T5/tmp/datalad_temp_test_push_recursiveu5n5sxxi
*       refs/heads/adjusted/master(unlocked):refs/heads/adjusted/master(unlocked)       [new branch]
Done
```

Datalad should actively prevent that.
